quote: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem:
author: Solomon

quote: |Vanity of vanities,| says the Preacher; |Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.|
author: Solomon

quote: What does man gain from all his labor in which he labors under the sun?
author: Solomon

quote: One generation goes, and another generation comes; but the earth remains forever.
author: Solomon

quote: The sun also rises, and the sun goes down, and hurries to its place where it rises.
author: Solomon

quote: The wind goes toward the south, and turns around to the north. It turns around continually as it goes, and the wind returns again to its courses.
author: Solomon

quote: All the rivers run into the sea, yet the sea is not full. To the place where the rivers flow, there they flow again.
author: Solomon

quote: All things are full of weariness beyond uttering. The eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.
author: Solomon

quote: That which has been is that which shall be; and that which has been done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: Is there a thing of which it may be said, |Behold, this is new?| It has been long ago, in the ages which were before us.
author: Solomon

quote: There is no memory of the former; neither shall there be any memory of the latter that are to come, among those that shall come after.
author: Solomon

quote: I, the Preacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
author: Solomon

quote: I applied my heart to seek and to search out by wisdom concerning all that is done under the sky. It is a heavy burden that God has given to the sons of men to be afflicted with.
author: Solomon

quote: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and behold, all is vanity and a chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: That which is crooked can't be made straight; and that which is lacking can't be counted.
author: Solomon

quote: I said to myself, |Behold, I have obtained for myself great wisdom above all who were before me in Jerusalem. Yes, my heart has had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.|
author: Solomon

quote: I applied my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly. I perceived that this also was a chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: For in much wisdom is much grief; and he who increases knowledge increases sorrow.
author: Solomon

quote: I said in my heart, |Come now, I will test you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure;| and behold, this also was vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: I said of laughter, |It is foolishness;| and of mirth, |What does it accomplish?|
author: Solomon

quote: I searched in my heart how to cheer my flesh with wine, my heart yet guiding me with wisdom, and how to lay hold of folly, until I might see what it was good for the sons of men that they should do under heaven all the days of their lives.
author: Solomon

quote: I made myself great works. I built myself houses. I planted myself vineyards.
author: Solomon

quote: I made myself gardens and parks, and I planted trees in them of all kinds of fruit.
author: Solomon

quote: I made myself pools of water, to water from it the forest where trees were reared.
author: Solomon

quote: I bought male servants and female servants, and had servants born in my house. I also had great possessions of herds and flocks, above all who were before me in Jerusalem;
author: Solomon

quote: I also gathered silver and gold for myself, and the treasure of kings and of the provinces. I got myself male and female singers, and the delights of the sons of men—musical instruments, and that of all sorts.
author: Solomon

quote: So I was great, and increased more than all who were before me in Jerusalem. My wisdom also remained with me.
author: Solomon

quote: Whatever my eyes desired, I didn't keep from them. I didn't withhold my heart from any joy, for my heart rejoiced because of all my labor, and this was my portion from all my labor.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I looked at all the works that my hands had worked, and at the labor that I had labored to do; and behold, all was vanity and a chasing after wind, and there was no profit under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: I turned myself to consider wisdom, madness, and folly: for what can the king's successor do? Just that which has been done long ago.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I saw that wisdom excels folly, as far as light excels darkness.
author: Solomon

quote: The wise man's eyes are in his head, and the fool walks in darkness—and yet I perceived that one event happens to them all.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I said in my heart, |As it happens to the fool, so will it happen even to me; and why was I then more wise?| Then I said in my heart that this also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: For of the wise man, even as of the fool, there is no memory for ever, since in the days to come all will have been long forgotten. Indeed, the wise man must die just like the fool!
author: Solomon

quote: So I hated life, because the work that is worked under the sun was grievous to me; for all is vanity and a chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: I hated all my labor in which I labored under the sun, because I must leave it to the man who comes after me.
author: Solomon

quote: Who knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool? Yet he will have rule over all of my labor in which I have labored, and in which I have shown myself wise under the sun. This also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore I began to cause my heart to despair concerning all the labor in which I had labored under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: For there is a man whose labor is with wisdom, with knowledge, and with skillfulness; yet he shall leave it for his portion to a man who has not labored for it. This also is vanity and a great evil.
author: Solomon

quote: For what has a man of all his labor, and of the striving of his heart, in which he labors under the sun?
author: Solomon

quote: For all his days are sorrows, and his travail is grief; yes, even in the night his heart takes no rest. This also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: There is nothing better for a man than that he should eat and drink, and make his soul enjoy good in his labor. This also I saw, that it is from the hand of God.
author: Solomon

quote: For who can eat, or who can have enjoyment, more than I?
author: Solomon

quote: For to the man who pleases him, God gives wisdom, knowledge, and joy; but to the sinner he gives travail, to gather and to heap up, that he may give to him who pleases God. This also is vanity and a chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: For everything there is a season, and a time for every purpose under heaven:
author: Solomon

quote: a time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;
author: Solomon

quote: a time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;
author: Solomon

quote: a time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
author: Solomon

quote: a time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
author: Solomon

quote: a time to seek, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
author: Solomon

quote: a time to tear, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
author: Solomon

quote: a time to love, and a time to hate; a time for war, and a time for peace.
author: Solomon

quote: What profit has he who works in that in which he labors?
author: Solomon

quote: I have seen the burden which God has given to the sons of men to be afflicted with.
author: Solomon

quote: He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in their hearts, yet so that man can't find out the work that God has done from the beginning even to the end.
author: Solomon

quote: I know that there is nothing better for them than to rejoice, and to do good as long as they live.
author: Solomon

quote: Also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy good in all his labor, is the gift of God.
author: Solomon

quote: I know that whatever God does, it shall be forever. Nothing can be added to it, nor anything taken from it; and God has done it, that men should fear before him.
author: Solomon

quote: That which is has been long ago, and that which is to be has been long ago: and God seeks again that which is passed away.
author: Solomon

quote: Moreover I saw under the sun, in the place of justice, that wickedness was there; and in the place of righteousness, that wickedness was there.
author: Solomon

quote: I said in my heart, |God will judge the righteous and the wicked; for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.|
author: Solomon

quote: I said in my heart, |As for the sons of men, God tests them, so that they may see that they themselves are like animals.
author: Solomon

quote: For that which happens to the sons of men happens to animals. Even one thing happens to them. As the one dies, so the other dies. Yes, they have all one breath; and man has no advantage over the animals: for all is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: All go to one place. All are from the dust, and all turn to dust again.
author: Solomon

quote: Who knows the spirit of man, whether it goes upward, and the spirit of the animal, whether it goes downward to the earth?|
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore I saw that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his works; for that is his portion: for who can bring him to see what will be after him?
author: Solomon

quote: Then I returned and saw all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold, the tears of those who were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore I praised the dead who have been long dead more than the living who are yet alive.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, better than them both is him who has not yet been, who has not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I saw all the labor and achievement that is the envy of a man's neighbor. This also is vanity and a striving after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: The fool folds his hands together and ruins himself.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is a handful, with quietness, than two handfuls with labor and chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I returned and saw vanity under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: There is one who is alone, and he has neither son nor brother. There is no end to all of his labor, neither are his eyes satisfied with wealth. |For whom then, do I labor, and deprive my soul of enjoyment?| This also is vanity. Yes, it is a miserable business.
author: Solomon

quote: Two are better than one, because they have a good reward for their labor.
author: Solomon

quote: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow; but woe to him who is alone when he falls, and doesn't have another to lift him up.
author: Solomon

quote: Again, if two lie together, then they have warmth; but how can one keep warm alone?
author: Solomon

quote: If a man prevails against one who is alone, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is a poor and wise youth than an old and foolish king who doesn't know how to receive admonition any more.
author: Solomon

quote: For out of prison he came forth to be king; yes, even in his kingdom he was born poor.
author: Solomon

quote: I saw all the living who walk under the sun, that they were with the youth, the other, who succeeded him.
author: Solomon

quote: There was no end of all the people, even of all them over whom he was—yet those who come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and a chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: Guard your steps when you go to God's house; for to draw near to listen is better than to give the sacrifice of fools, for they don't know that they do evil.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be rash with your mouth, and don't let your heart be hasty to utter anything before God; for God is in heaven, and you on earth. Therefore let your words be few.
author: Solomon

quote: For as a dream comes with a multitude of cares, so a fool's speech with a multitude of words.
author: Solomon

quote: When you vow a vow to God, don't defer to pay it; for he has no pleasure in fools. Pay that which you vow.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better that you should not vow, than that you should vow and not pay.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't allow your mouth to lead you into sin. Don't protest before the messenger that this was a mistake. Why should God be angry at your voice, and destroy the work of your hands?
author: Solomon

quote: For in the multitude of dreams there are vanities, as well as in many words: but you must fear God.
author: Solomon

quote: If you see the oppression of the poor, and the violent taking away of justice and righteousness in a district, don't marvel at the matter: for one official is eyed by a higher one; and there are officials over them.
author: Solomon

quote: Moreover the profit of the earth is for all. The king profits from the field.
author: Solomon

quote: He who loves silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves abundance, with increase: this also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: When goods increase, those who eat them are increased; and what advantage is there to its owner, except to feast on them with his eyes?
author: Solomon

quote: The sleep of a laboring man is sweet, whether he eats little or much; but the abundance of the rich will not allow him to sleep.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a grievous evil which I have seen under the sun: wealth kept by its owner to his harm.
author: Solomon

quote: Those riches perish by misfortune, and if he has fathered a son, there is nothing in his hand.
author: Solomon

quote: As he came forth from his mother's womb, naked shall he go again as he came, and shall take nothing for his labor, which he may carry away in his hand.
author: Solomon

quote: This also is a grievous evil, that in all points as he came, so shall he go. And what profit does he have who labors for the wind?
author: Solomon

quote: All his days he also eats in darkness, he is frustrated, and has sickness and wrath.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, that which I have seen to be good and proper is for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy good in all his labor, in which he labors under the sun, all the days of his life which God has given him; for this is his portion.
author: Solomon

quote: Every man also to whom God has given riches and wealth, and has given him power to eat of it, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labor—this is the gift of God.
author: Solomon

quote: For he shall not often reflect on the days of his life; because God occupies him with the joy of his heart.
author: Solomon

quote: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is heavy on men:
author: Solomon

quote: a man to whom God gives riches, wealth, and honor, so that he lacks nothing for his soul of all that he desires, yet God gives him no power to eat of it, but an alien eats it. This is vanity, and it is an evil disease.
author: Solomon

quote: If a man fathers a hundred children, and lives many years, so that the days of his years are many, but his soul is not filled with good, and moreover he has no burial; I say, that a stillborn child is better than he:
author: Solomon

quote: for it comes in vanity, and departs in darkness, and its name is covered with darkness.
author: Solomon

quote: Moreover it has not seen the sun nor known it. This has rest rather than the other.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, though he live a thousand years twice told, and yet fails to enjoy good, don't all go to one place?
author: Solomon

quote: All the labor of man is for his mouth, and yet the appetite is not filled.
author: Solomon

quote: For what advantage has the wise more than the fool? What has the poor man, that knows how to walk before the living?
author: Solomon

quote: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire. This also is vanity and a chasing after wind.
author: Solomon

quote: Whatever has been, its name was given long ago; and it is known what man is; neither can he contend with him who is mightier than he.
author: Solomon

quote: For there are many words that create vanity. What does that profit man?
author: Solomon

quote: For who knows what is good for man in life, all the days of his vain life which he spends like a shadow? For who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
author: Solomon

quote: A good name is better than fine perfume; and the day of death better than the day of one's birth.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better to go to the house of mourning than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men, and the living should take this to heart.
author: Solomon

quote: Sorrow is better than laughter; for by the sadness of the face the heart is made good.
author: Solomon

quote: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.
author: Solomon

quote: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool. This also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: Surely extortion makes the wise man foolish; and a bribe destroys the understanding.
author: Solomon

quote: Better is the end of a thing than its beginning. The patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be hasty in your spirit to be angry, for anger rests in the bosom of fools.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't say, |Why were the former days better than these?| For you do not ask wisely about this.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is as good as an inheritance. Yes, it is more excellent for those who see the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: For wisdom is a defense, even as money is a defense; but the excellency of knowledge is that wisdom preserves the life of him who has it.
author: Solomon

quote: Consider the work of God, for who can make that straight, which he has made crooked?
author: Solomon

quote: In the day of prosperity be joyful, and in the day of adversity consider; yes, God has made the one side by side with the other, to the end that man should not find out anything after him.
author: Solomon

quote: All this have I seen in my days of vanity: there is a righteous man who perishes in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man who lives long in his evildoing.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be overly righteous, neither make yourself overly wise. Why should you destroy yourself?
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be too wicked, neither be foolish. Why should you die before your time?
author: Solomon

quote: It is good that you should take hold of this. Yes, also from that don't withdraw your hand; for he who fears God will come forth from them all.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is a strength to the wise man more than ten rulers who are in a city.
author: Solomon

quote: Surely there is not a righteous man on earth, who does good and doesn't sin.
author: Solomon

quote: Also don't take heed to all words that are spoken, lest you hear your servant curse you;
author: Solomon

quote: for often your own heart knows that you yourself have likewise cursed others.
author: Solomon

quote: All this have I proved in wisdom. I said, |I will be wise;| but it was far from me.
author: Solomon

quote: That which is, is far off and exceedingly deep. Who can find it out?
author: Solomon

quote: I turned around, and my heart sought to know and to search out, and to seek wisdom and the scheme of things, and to know that wickedness is stupidity, and that foolishness is madness.
author: Solomon

quote: I find more bitter than death the woman whose heart is snares and traps, whose hands are chains. Whoever pleases God shall escape from her; but the sinner will be ensnared by her.
author: Solomon

quote: |Behold, I have found this,| says the Preacher, |one to another, to find out the scheme;
author: Solomon

quote: which my soul still seeks; but I have not found. One man among a thousand have I found; but I have not found a woman among all those.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, this only have I found: that God made man upright; but they search for many schemes.|
author: Solomon

quote: Who is like the wise man? And who knows the interpretation of a thing? A man's wisdom makes his face shine, and the hardness of his face is changed.
author: Solomon

quote: I say, |Keep the king's command!| because of the oath to God.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be hasty to go out of his presence. Don't persist in an evil thing, for he does whatever pleases him,
author: Solomon

quote: for the king's word is supreme. Who can say to him, |What are you doing?|
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever keeps the commandment shall not come to harm, and his wise heart will know the time and procedure.
author: Solomon

quote: For there is a time and procedure for every purpose, although the misery of man is heavy on him.
author: Solomon

quote: For he doesn't know that which will be; for who can tell him how it will be?
author: Solomon

quote: There is no man who has power over the spirit to contain the spirit; neither does he have power over the day of death. There is no discharge in war; neither shall wickedness deliver those who practice it.
author: Solomon

quote: All this have I seen, and applied my mind to every work that is done under the sun. There is a time in which one man has power over another to his hurt.
author: Solomon

quote: So I saw the wicked buried. Indeed they came also from holiness. They went and were forgotten in the city where they did this. This also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.
author: Solomon

quote: Though a sinner commits crimes a hundred times, and lives long, yet surely I know that it will be better with those who fear God, who are reverent before him.
author: Solomon

quote: But it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he lengthen days like a shadow; because he doesn't fear God.
author: Solomon

quote: There is a vanity which is done on the earth, that there are righteous men to whom it happens according to the work of the wicked. Again, there are wicked men to whom it happens according to the work of the righteous. I said that this also is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I commended mirth, because a man has no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be joyful: for that will accompany him in his labor all the days of his life which God has given him under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: When I applied my heart to know wisdom, and to see the business that is done on the earth (for also there is that neither day nor night sees sleep with his eyes),
author: Solomon

quote: then I saw all the work of God, that man can't find out the work that is done under the sun, because however much a man labors to seek it out, yet he won't find it. Yes even though a wise man thinks he can comprehend it, he won't be able to find it.
author: Solomon

quote: For all this I laid to my heart, even to explore all this: that the righteous, and the wise, and their works, are in the hand of God; whether it is love or hatred, man doesn't know it; all is before them.
author: Solomon

quote: All things come alike to all. There is one event to the righteous and to the wicked; to the good, to the clean, to the unclean, to him who sacrifices, and to him who doesn't sacrifice. As is the good, so is the sinner; he who takes an oath, as he who fears an oath.
author: Solomon

quote: This is an evil in all that is done under the sun, that there is one event to all: yes also, the heart of the sons of men is full of evil, and madness is in their heart while they live, and after that they go to the dead.
author: Solomon

quote: For to him who is joined with all the living there is hope; for a living dog is better than a dead lion.
author: Solomon

quote: For the living know that they will die, but the dead don't know anything, neither do they have any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.
author: Solomon

quote: Also their love, their hatred, and their envy has perished long ago; neither have they any more a portion forever in anything that is done under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: Go your way—eat your bread with joy, and drink your wine with a merry heart; for God has already accepted your works.
author: Solomon

quote: Let your garments be always white, and don't let your head lack oil.
author: Solomon

quote: Live joyfully with the wife whom you love all the days of your life of vanity, which he has given you under the sun, all your days of vanity: for that is your portion in life, and in your labor in which you labor under the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in Sheol, where you are going.
author: Solomon

quote: I returned, and saw under the sun, that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favor to men of skill; but time and chance happen to them all.
author: Solomon

quote: For man also doesn't know his time. As the fish that are taken in an evil net, and as the birds that are caught in the snare, even so are the sons of men snared in an evil time, when it falls suddenly on them.
author: Solomon

quote: I have also seen wisdom under the sun in this way, and it seemed great to me.
author: Solomon

quote: There was a little city, and few men within it; and a great king came against it, besieged it, and built great bulwarks against it.
author: Solomon

quote: Now a poor wise man was found in it, and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.
author: Solomon

quote: Then I said, |Wisdom is better than strength.| Nevertheless the poor man's wisdom is despised, and his words are not heard.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of the wise heard in quiet are better than the cry of him who rules among fools.
author: Solomon

quote: Wisdom is better than weapons of war; but one sinner destroys much good.
author: Solomon

quote: Dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to send forth an evil odor; so does a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor.
author: Solomon

quote: A wise man's heart is at his right hand, but a fool's heart at his left.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes also, when the fool walks by the way, his understanding fails him, and he says to everyone that he is a fool.
author: Solomon

quote: If the spirit of the ruler rises up against you, don't leave your place; for gentleness lays great offenses to rest.
author: Solomon

quote: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, the sort of error which proceeds from the ruler.
author: Solomon

quote: Folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in a low place.
author: Solomon

quote: I have seen servants on horses, and princes walking like servants on the earth.
author: Solomon

quote: He who digs a pit may fall into it; and whoever breaks through a wall may be bitten by a snake.
author: Solomon

quote: Whoever carves out stones may be injured by them. Whoever splits wood may be endangered thereby.
author: Solomon

quote: If the axe is blunt, and one doesn't sharpen the edge, then he must use more strength; but skill brings success.
author: Solomon

quote: If the snake bites before it is charmed, then is there no profit for the charmer's tongue.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but a fool is swallowed by his own lips.
author: Solomon

quote: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness; and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.
author: Solomon

quote: A fool also multiplies words. Man doesn't know what will be; and that which will be after him, who can tell him?
author: Solomon

quote: The labor of fools wearies every one of them; for he doesn't know how to go to the city.
author: Solomon

quote: Woe to you, land, when your king is a child, and your princes eat in the morning!
author: Solomon

quote: Happy are you, land, when your king is the son of nobles, and your princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!
author: Solomon

quote: By slothfulness the roof sinks in; and through idleness of the hands the house leaks.
author: Solomon

quote: A feast is made for laughter, and wine makes the life glad; and money is the answer for all things.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't curse the king, no, not in your thoughts; and don't curse the rich in your bedroom: for a bird of the sky may carry your voice, and that which has wings may tell the matter.
author: Solomon

quote: Cast your bread on the waters; for you shall find it after many days.
author: Solomon

quote: Give a portion to seven, yes, even to eight; for you don't know what evil will be on the earth.
author: Solomon

quote: If the clouds are full of rain, they empty themselves on the earth; and if a tree falls toward the south, or toward the north, in the place where the tree falls, there shall it be.
author: Solomon

quote: He who observes the wind won't sow; and he who regards the clouds won't reap.
author: Solomon

quote: As you don't know what is the way of the wind, nor how the bones grow in the womb of her who is with child; even so you don't know the work of God who does all.
author: Solomon

quote: In the morning sow your seed, and in the evening don't withhold your hand; for you don't know which will prosper, whether this or that, or whether they both will be equally good.
author: Solomon

quote: Truly the light is sweet, and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to see the sun.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, if a man lives many years, let him rejoice in them all; but let him remember the days of darkness, for they shall be many. All that comes is vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: Rejoice, young man, in your youth, and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth, and walk in the ways of your heart, and in the sight of your eyes; but know that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore remove sorrow from your heart, and put away evil from your flesh; for youth and the dawn of life are vanity.
author: Solomon

quote: Remember also your Creator in the days of your youth, before the evil days come, and the years draw near, when you will say, |I have no pleasure in them;|
author: Solomon

quote: Before the sun, the light, the moon, and the stars are darkened, and the clouds return after the rain;
author: Solomon

quote: in the day when the keepers of the house shall tremble, and the strong men shall bow themselves, and the grinders cease because they are few, and those who look out of the windows are darkened,
author: Solomon

quote: and the doors shall be shut in the street; when the sound of the grinding is low, and one shall rise up at the voice of a bird, and all the daughters of music shall be brought low;
author: Solomon

quote: yes, they shall be afraid of heights, and terrors will be in the way; and the almond tree shall blossom, and the grasshopper shall be a burden, and desire shall fail; because man goes to his everlasting home, and the mourners go about the streets:
author: Solomon

quote: before the silver cord is severed, or the golden bowl is broken, or the pitcher is broken at the spring, or the wheel broken at the cistern,
author: Solomon

quote: and the dust returns to the earth as it was, and the spirit returns to God who gave it.
author: Solomon

quote: |Vanity of vanities,| says the Preacher. |All is vanity!|
author: Solomon

quote: Further, because the Preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge. Yes, he pondered, sought out, and set in order many proverbs.
author: Solomon

quote: The Preacher sought to find out acceptable words, and that which was written blamelessly, words of truth.
author: Solomon

quote: The words of the wise are like goads; and like nails well fastened are words from the masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd.
author: Solomon

quote: Furthermore, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.
author: Solomon

quote: This is the end of the matter. All has been heard. Fear God, and keep his commandments; for this is the whole duty of man.
author: Solomon

quote: For God will bring every work into judgment, with every hidden thing, whether it is good, or whether it is evil.
author: Solomon

quote: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.
author: Solomon

quote: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations,
author: Solomon

quote: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.
author: Solomon

quote: Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.
author: Solomon

quote: But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach; and it will be given to him.
author: Solomon

quote: But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed.
author: Solomon

quote: For let that man not think that he will receive anything from the Lord.
author: Solomon

quote: He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways.
author: Solomon

quote: But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;
author: Solomon

quote: and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away.
author: Solomon

quote: For the sun arises with the scorching wind, and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So also will the rich man fade away in his pursuits.
author: Solomon

quote: Blessed is the man who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him.
author: Solomon

quote: Let no man say when he is tempted, |I am tempted by God,| for God can't be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.
author: Solomon

quote: But each one is tempted, when he is drawn away by his own lust, and enticed.
author: Solomon

quote: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, brings forth death.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't be deceived, my beloved brothers.
author: Solomon

quote: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation, nor turning shadow.
author: Solomon

quote: Of his own will he brought us forth by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures.
author: Solomon

quote: So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger;
author: Solomon

quote: for the anger of man doesn't produce the righteousness of God.
author: Solomon

quote: Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.
author: Solomon

quote: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves.
author: Solomon

quote: For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror;
author: Solomon

quote: for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.
author: Solomon

quote: But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom, and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does.
author: Solomon

quote: If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn't bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man's religion is worthless.
author: Solomon

quote: Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.
author: Solomon

quote: My brothers, don't hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality.
author: Solomon

quote: For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in;
author: Solomon

quote: and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, |Sit here in a good place;| and you tell the poor man, |Stand there,| or |Sit by my footstool;|
author: Solomon

quote: haven't you shown partiality among yourselves, and become judges with evil thoughts?
author: Solomon

quote: Listen, my beloved brothers. Didn't God choose those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith, and heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him?
author: Solomon

quote: But you have dishonored the poor man. Don't the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?
author: Solomon

quote: Don't they blaspheme the honorable name by which you are called?
author: Solomon

quote: However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture, |You shall love your neighbor as yourself,| you do well.
author: Solomon

quote: But if you show partiality, you commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors.
author: Solomon

quote: For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all.
author: Solomon

quote: For he who said, |Do not commit adultery,| also said, |Do not commit murder.| Now if you do not commit adultery, but murder, you have become a transgressor of the law.
author: Solomon

quote: So speak, and so do, as men who are to be judged by a law of freedom.
author: Solomon

quote: For judgment is without mercy to him who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.
author: Solomon

quote: What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?
author: Solomon

quote: And if a brother or sister is naked and in lack of daily food,
author: Solomon

quote: and one of you tells them, |Go in peace, be warmed and filled;| and yet you didn't give them the things the body needs, what good is it?
author: Solomon

quote: Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself.
author: Solomon

quote: Yes, a man will say, |You have faith, and I have works.| Show me your faith without works, and I by my works will show you my faith.
author: Solomon

quote: You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder.
author: Solomon

quote: But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead?
author: Solomon

quote: Wasn't Abraham our father justified by works, in that he offered up Isaac his son on the altar?
author: Solomon

quote: You see that faith worked with his works, and by works faith was perfected;
author: Solomon

quote: and the Scripture was fulfilled which says, |Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness;| and he was called the friend of God.
author: Solomon

quote: You see then that by works, a man is justified, and not only by faith.
author: Solomon

quote: In the same way, wasn't Rahab the prostitute also justified by works, in that she received the messengers, and sent them out another way?
author: Solomon

quote: For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, even so faith apart from works is dead.
author: Solomon

quote: Let not many of you be teachers, my brothers, knowing that we will receive heavier judgment.
author: Solomon

quote: For in many things we all stumble. If anyone doesn't stumble in word, the same is a perfect man, able to bridle the whole body also.
author: Solomon

quote: Indeed, we put bits into the horses' mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, the ships also, though they are so big and are driven by fierce winds, are yet guided by a very small rudder, wherever the pilot desires.
author: Solomon

quote: So the tongue is also a little member, and boasts great things. See how a small fire can spread to a large forest!
author: Solomon

quote: And the tongue is a fire. The world of iniquity among our members is the tongue, which defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by Gehenna.
author: Solomon

quote: For every kind of animal, bird, creeping thing, and thing in the sea, is tamed, and has been tamed by mankind.
author: Solomon

quote: But nobody can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.
author: Solomon

quote: With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men, who are made in the image of God.
author: Solomon

quote: Out of the same mouth comes forth blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so.
author: Solomon

quote: Does a spring send out from the same opening fresh and bitter water?
author: Solomon

quote: Can a fig tree, my brothers, yield olives, or a vine figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh water.
author: Solomon

quote: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show by his good conduct that his deeds are done in gentleness of wisdom.
author: Solomon

quote: But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your heart, don't boast and don't lie against the truth.
author: Solomon

quote: This wisdom is not that which comes down from above, but is earthly, sensual, and demonic.
author: Solomon

quote: For where jealousy and selfish ambition are, there is confusion and every evil deed.
author: Solomon

quote: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceful, gentle, reasonable, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
author: Solomon

quote: Now the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.
author: Solomon

quote: Where do wars and fightings among you come from? Don't they come from your pleasures that war in your members?
author: Solomon

quote: You lust, and don't have. You kill, covet, and can't obtain. You fight and make war. You don't have, because you don't ask.
author: Solomon

quote: You ask, and don't receive, because you ask with wrong motives, so that you may spend it for your pleasures.
author: Solomon

quote: You adulterers and adulteresses, don't you know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
author: Solomon

quote: Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, |The Spirit who lives in us yearns jealously|?
author: Solomon

quote: But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, |God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.|
author: Solomon

quote: Be subject therefore to God. But resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
author: Solomon

quote: Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
author: Solomon

quote: Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom.
author: Solomon

quote: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge.
author: Solomon

quote: Only one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge another?
author: Solomon

quote: Come now, you who say, |Today or tomorrow let's go into this city, and spend a year there, trade, and make a profit.|
author: Solomon

quote: Whereas you don't know what your life will be like tomorrow. For what is your life? For you are a vapor, that appears for a little time, and then vanishes away.
author: Solomon

quote: For you ought to say, |If the Lord wills, we will both live, and do this or that.|
author: Solomon

quote: But now you glory in your boasting. All such boasting is evil.
author: Solomon

quote: To him therefore who knows to do good, and doesn't do it, to him it is sin.
author: Solomon

quote: Come now, you rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming on you.
author: Solomon

quote: Your riches are corrupted and your garments are moth-eaten.
author: Solomon

quote: Your gold and your silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be for a testimony against you, and will eat your flesh like fire. You have laid up your treasure in the last days.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, the wages of the laborers who mowed your fields, which you have kept back by fraud, cry out, and the cries of those who reaped have entered into the ears of the Lord of Armies.
author: Solomon

quote: You have lived delicately on the earth, and taken your pleasure. You have nourished your hearts as in a day of slaughter.
author: Solomon

quote: You have condemned, you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn't resist you.
author: Solomon

quote: Be patient therefore, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient over it, until it receives the early and late rain.
author: Solomon

quote: You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is at hand.
author: Solomon

quote: Don't grumble, brothers, against one another, so that you won't be judged. Behold, the judge stands at the door.
author: Solomon

quote: Take, brothers, for an example of suffering and of patience, the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.
author: Solomon

quote: Behold, we call them blessed who endured. You have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the Lord in the outcome, and how the Lord is full of compassion and mercy.
author: Solomon

quote: But above all things, my brothers, don't swear, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath; but let your |yes| be |yes,| and your |no,| |no;| so that you don't fall into hypocrisy.
author: Solomon

quote: Is any among you suffering? Let him pray. Is any cheerful? Let him sing praises.
author: Solomon

quote: Is any among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord,
author: Solomon

quote: and the prayer of faith will heal him who is sick, and the Lord will raise him up. If he has committed sins, he will be forgiven.
author: Solomon

quote: Confess your offenses to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.
author: Solomon

quote: Elijah was a man with a nature like ours, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain, and it didn't rain on the earth for three years and six months.
author: Solomon

quote: He prayed again, and the sky gave rain, and the earth brought forth its fruit.
author: Solomon

quote: Brothers, if any among you wanders from the truth, and someone turns him back,
author: Solomon

quote: let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death, and will cover a multitude of sins.
author: Solomon
